gw.api.webservice.cc.dataExtraction

Class CCDataExtractionAPIImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.webservice.pl.dataExtraction.DataExtractionAPIImpl
      • gw.api.webservice.cc.dataExtraction.CCDataExtractionAPIImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataExtractionAPIBase, DataExtractionRenderer, java.rmi.Remote

    public class CCDataExtractionAPIImpl
extends DataExtractionAPIImpl
    Guidewire Software. This is the implementation behind IDataExtraction API, a cc Gosu Web Service.

    Creator information: User: schan-tin Date: Mar 23, 2005 8:08:44 AM

    • Method Detail

      • viewClaimAndRenderWithTemplate

        public java.lang.String viewClaimAndRenderWithTemplate(java.lang.String claimNumber,
                                                       java.lang.String claimId,
                                                       NVParam[] params,
                                                       java.lang.String template)
        Looks up a claim by number or public id and evaluates the given template. The claim is available as "claim" in the evaluation context of the template. Also, the array of parameters is available in the context as a Map called "parameters"
        Parameters:
        claimNumber - the number of the claim. Either this or claimId should be non null
        claimId - the public id of the claim. Either this or claimNumber should be non null. If both claimId and claimNumber are specified, claimNumber is ignored
        params - parameters (name value pairs) to be inserted into the template
        template - the Gosu template, as a string
        Returns:
        the result of executing the template with the given claim and parameters

      • viewClaimAndRenderWithTemplateByName

        public java.lang.String viewClaimAndRenderWithTemplateByName(java.lang.String claimNumber,
                                                             java.lang.String claimId,
                                                             NVParam[] params,
                                                             java.lang.String templateFileName)
                                                      throws SOAPException
        Looks up a claim by number or public id and evaluates the named template. The claim is available as "claim" in the evaluation context of the template. Also, the array of parameters is available in the context as a Map called "parameters"
        Parameters:
        claimNumber - the number of the claim. Either this or claimId should be non null. If both claimId and claimNumber are specified, claimNumber is ignored
        claimId - the public id of the claim. Either this or claimNumber should be non null
        params - parameters (name value pairs) to be inserted into the template
        templateFileName - The name of the template file, which must be in config/templates/dataextraction
        Returns:
        the result of executing the template with the given claim and parameters
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • findClaimAndRenderWithTemplate

        public java.lang.String findClaimAndRenderWithTemplate(java.lang.String policyNumber,
                                                       java.lang.String policyId,
                                                       NVParam[] params,
                                                       java.lang.String template)
        Finds the claims with the given policy number and then evaluates the given template. The list of matching claims is available as "claim" in the evaluation context of the template. Also, the array of parameters is available in the context as a Map called "parameters"
        Parameters:
        policyNumber - the number of the policy. Either this or policyId should be non null
        policyId - the public id of the policy. Either this or policyNumber should be non null. If both policyId and policyNumber are specified, policyNumber is ignored
        params - parameters (name value pairs) to be inserted into the template
        template - the Gosu template, as a string
        Returns:
        the result of executing the template with the found claims and parameters

      • findClaimAndRenderWithTemplateByName

        public java.lang.String findClaimAndRenderWithTemplateByName(java.lang.String policyNumber,
                                                             java.lang.String policyId,
                                                             NVParam[] params,
                                                             java.lang.String templateFileName)
                                                      throws SOAPException
        Finds the claims with the given policy number and then evaluates the named template. The list of matching claims is available as "claim" in the evaluation context of the template. Also, the array of parameters is available in the context as a Map called "parameters"
        Parameters:
        policyNumber - the number of the policy. Either this or policyId should be non null
        policyId - the public id of the policy. Either this or policyNumber should be non null. If both policyId and policyNumber are specified, policyNumber is ignored
        params - parameters (name value pairs) to be inserted into the template
        templateFileName - The name of the template file, which must be in config/templates/dataextraction
        Returns:
        the result of executing the template with the found claims and parameters
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • viewUserAndRenderWithTemplate

        public java.lang.String viewUserAndRenderWithTemplate(java.lang.String userName,
                                                      boolean getActivities,
                                                      boolean getClaims,
                                                      NVParam[] params,
                                                      java.lang.String template)
        Finds the user with the given user name and then evaluates the given template. The user is available as "user" in the evaluation context of the template. Optionally also makes available the user's activities ("activities") and claims ("claims"). The array of parameters is available in the context as a Map called "parameters"
        Parameters:
        userName - the user name of the user to be viewed
        getActivities - if true, the users activities will be available to the template as "activities". if false, "activities" will be null
        getClaims - if true, the users claims will be available to the template as "claims". if false, "claims" will be null
        params - parameters (name value pairs) to be inserted into the template
        template - the Gosu template, as a string
        Returns:
        the result of executing the template with the user, activities, claims and parameters

      • viewUserAndRenderWithTemplateByName

        public java.lang.String viewUserAndRenderWithTemplateByName(java.lang.String userName,
                                                            boolean getActivities,
                                                            boolean getClaims,
                                                            NVParam[] params,
                                                            java.lang.String templateFileName)
                                                     throws SOAPException
        Finds the user with the given user name and then evaluates the named template. The user is available as "user" in the evaluation context of the template. Optionally also makes available the user's activities ("activities") and claims ("claims"). The array of parameters is available in the context as a Map called "parameters"
        Parameters:
        userName - the user name of the user to be viewed
        getActivities - if true, the users activities will be available to the template as "activities". if false, "activities" will be null
        getClaims - if true, the users claims will be available to the template as "claims". if false, "claims" will be null
        params - parameters (name value pairs) to be inserted into the template
        templateFileName - The name of the template file, which must be in config/templates/dataextraction
        Returns:
        the result of executing the template with the user, activities, claims and parameters
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • findCreatedExposuresAndRenderWithTemplateByName

        public java.lang.String findCreatedExposuresAndRenderWithTemplateByName(java.util.Calendar startDate,
                                                                        java.util.Calendar endDate,
                                                                        java.lang.String templateFileName)
                                                                 throws SOAPException
        Finds the exposures created in the given time period and then evaluates the named template. The list of exposures is available as "exposures" in the evaluation context of the template. Also, the array of parameters is available in the context as a Map called "parameters"
        Parameters:
        startDate - The start of the desired time period. Can be null
        endDate - The end of the desired time period. Can be null
        templateFileName - The name of the template file, which must be in config/templates/dataextraction
        Returns:
        Info for each exposure created in the given time period.
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • findCreatedExposuresAndRenderWithTemplate

        public java.lang.String findCreatedExposuresAndRenderWithTemplate(java.util.Calendar startDate,
                                                                  java.util.Calendar endDate,
                                                                  java.lang.String template)
        Finds the exposures created in the given time period and then evaluates the given template. The list of exposures is available as "exposures" in the evaluation context of the template. Also, the array of parameters is available in the context as a Map called "parameters"
        Parameters:
        startDate - The start of the desired time period. Can be null
        endDate - The end of the desired time period. Can be null.
        template - The Gosu template
        Returns:
        Info for each exposure created in the given time period.
